etymology.description: Semantic: 心(心) (xīn, 'heart') + Phonetic: 壹(壹) (yī) = heart symbolizing virtuous qualities + 壹 lending sound and suggesting offerings or ceremonial vessels -> virtuous
etymology.interpretation: Incorporating 心(心) (xīn, 'heart') emphasizes inner virtues and moral qualities, while the phonetic 壹(壹) (yī) enhances its meaning with associations to ceremonial respect and excellence, aligning with traditional ideals of virtue.

examples.chinese: 君子崇尚懿德(君子崇尚懿德)。
他身上流露出懿德之風(他身上流露出懿德之風)，使人肅然起敬(使人肅然起敬)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shēnshàng liúlòu chū yì dé zhī fēng, shǐ rén sùrán qǐ jìng.
examples.english: He exudes a spirit of virtue that inspires deep respect in others.
